content: In 1925, which author of 'The Great Gatsby' lived in Paris among other expatriate American authors?

F. Scott Fitzgerald is the author of 'The Great Gatsby,' and he did live in Paris among other expatriate American authors in the 1920s. This period was part of what is often referred to as the "Lost Generation," a group of American literary figures who lived in Europe, particularly Paris, during this time. Other notable authors in this group include Ernest Hemingway and Gertrude Stein.
